FuncDef: To set the number of lines on the current terminal screen for the current session, use the **terminalÂ length** command in EXEC, privileged EXEC, and diagnostic mode.

ParaDef.Info: Number of lines on the screen. A value of zero disables pausing between screens of output.

Examples: In the following example, the system is configured to prevent output from pausing if it exceeds the length of the screen:
ExtraInfo: The system uses the length value to determine when to pause during multiple-screen output. A value of zero prevents the router from pausing between screens of output.Some types of terminal sessions do not require you to specify the screen length because the screen length specified can be learned by some remote hosts. For example, the rlogin protocol uses the screen length to set up terminal parameters on a remote UNIX host.
